result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution hearing scheduled for 11-14-2016 at 8:30 am

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashinna Evette Wilson

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $68 witness fees for witness Carmen T. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25480412 in court 4x on 12/2/15, 5/9/16, 6/27/16, 4/6/16.

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Court sets restitution at zero (0.00).
Witness fee request prepared for Carmen T. was approved for 4 appearances on 12/2/15, 5/9/16, 6/27/16, 4/6/16 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Carmen T. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $200.00 inclusive of all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge), to be taken from the $200.00 cash bail on deposit.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Defendant to have no contact with Carmen T.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed. 

Restitution hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Victim impact statements, received from the State and filed. LNR
* DEFENDANT HAS POSTED $100.00, DEFENDANT TO POST $100.00 TO BE RELEASED * All previously ordered conditons of bail remain the same.

The Court INCREASES the Defendant's bail to $200.00. 
*DEFENDANT HAS ALREADY POSTED $100.00. DEFENDANT WILL NEED TO POST $100.00 TO BE RELEASED*

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Defense requests an adjournment due to health issues with her client. Discussions placed on the record. The State does not object to adjournment. Case calendared for sentencing on 10/28/2016 at 01:30 pm, Branch 47. Due to the offense the Court would like to review bail. Case proceeded to bail/bond hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court sets cash bail in the amount of $100.00. All other previously ordered terms and conditions remain same.

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing. Court allows attorney Christina E. Balistreri to be attorney of record. Defense counsel requests more time.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Carmen T., received and filed.

16RM044572  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/23/2016

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec. 947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty to the amended charge.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as  to the amended charge in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn the trial is granted.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State filed amended witness list.
STate filed witness list; proposed jury instructions and motion in limine.
Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Case remains on for jury trial.

Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47,  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/2/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Status conference scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Carmen T. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Lashinna Evette Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Status Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/1/15 @ 1:30pm
